Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: The cat can survive fall from a height much more than human or any other animal. It is because the cat
options: can immediately adjust itself to land on all four paws and bend the legs to absorb the impact of falling
also gets injury equally with other animals, but has tremendous endurance, resistance and speedy recovery
Physics (Mechanics).answer: can immediately adjust itself to land on all four paws and bend the legs to absorb the impact of falling
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: As the cat falls from a height, it bends the legs to absorb the impact of falling and immediately adjust itself.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: A body has a mass of 6 kg on the Earth; when measured on the Moon, its mass would be
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: Mass of an object does not change when an objects location changes. It is the weight of the body (w = mg) which changes with value of 'g' at that place.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: When a ball drops onto the floor it bounces. Why does it bounce?
options: Newton's third law implies that for every action (drop) there is a reaction (bounce)
The floor exerts a force on the ball during the impact
The floor heats up on impact
Physics (Mechanics).answer: The floor exerts a force on the ball during the impact
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: When a ball drops on to the floor then floor exerts a force for small time which is equal to change in momentum of the ball.

Physics (General).subject: Physics (General)
Physics (General).question: Fire fly gives us cold light by virtue of the phenomenon of
Physics (General).explanation: Fire fly gives us cold light due to chemiluminescence i.e. light produced by chemical reaction.

Physics (Electromagnetism).subject: Physics (Electromagnetism)
Physics (Electromagnetism).question:
Transformer is a kind of appliance that can
1. increase power 2. increase voltage
3. decrease voltage
4. measure current and voltage
Select the correct answer using the codes given below
Physics (Electromagnetism).explanation: Transformer is an appliance that can increase or decrease voltage.

Physics (Electromagnetism).subject: Physics (Electromagnetism)
Physics (Electromagnetism).question: When you pull out the plug connected to an electrical appliance, you often observe a spark. To which property of the appliance is this related?
Physics (Electromagnetism).explanation: As the plug is pulled out, the value of resistance in the circuit decreases and hence more current tries to flow through the circuit. Pulling out the plug breaks the circuit and to complete the circuit for the flow of electricity a spark is observed.

Physics (Thermodynamics).subject: Physics (Thermodynamics)
Physics (Thermodynamics).question: If the door of a running refrigerator in a closed room is kept open, what will be the net effect on the room?
options: It will make no difference on the average
It will make the temperature go up and down
Physics (Thermodynamics).explanation: It will heat the room because the heat removed from the inside is released into the room, counter acting any cooling, plus the energy that is used to operate the compressor eventually winds up being heat, therefore increasing the room temperature.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: The focal length of convex lens is
options: shorter for blue light than for red
shorter for red light than for blue
Physics (Optics).answer: shorter for blue light than for red
Physics (Optics).explanation: The focal length of a convex lens is shorter for blue light than for red.

Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Applied Chemistry)
Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).question: One of the occupational health hazards commonly faced by the workers of ceramics, pottery and glass industry is
Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).explanation: Silicosis is a chronic lung disease caused by breathing in silica dust. Silicosis (silico tuberculosis) occurs in workers whose occupation is related to pottery, ceramic, and glass industry.

Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Applied Chemistry)
Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).question: Sodium thiosulphate (Na2S2O3) solution is used in photography to
options: reduce silver bromide (AgBr) grain to silver
remove undecomposed AgBr as a soluble silver thiosulphate complex
convert the metallic silver to silver salt
Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).answer: remove undecomposed AgBr as a soluble silver thiosulphate complex
Chemistry (Applied Chemistry).explanation:
Sodium thiosulphate (Na2S2O3) solution is used as fixer in photography, it removes undercomposed AgBr as a soluble silver thiosulphate complex.
AgBr +2Na2S2O3 ® Na3[Ag(S2O3)2]+ NaBr
Sodiumargento thiosulphate

Chemistry (Electrochemistry).subject: Chemistry (Electrochemistry)
Chemistry (Electrochemistry).question: Sacrificial anode protects iron or ships, underground pipelines etc from rusting, a process known as cathodic protection. Which one of the following metals cannot be used as a sacrificial anode?
Chemistry (Electrochemistry).explanation: The method of protection of iron from corrosion by using a more reactive metal is known as sacrificial protection or cathodic protection. Zinc, magnesium and aluminium metals are more reactive than iron hence, they are used as a sacrificial anode while tin is less reactive than iron hence, it cannot be used as a sacrificial anode.

Chemistry (Electrochemistry).subject: Chemistry (Electrochemistry)
Chemistry (Electrochemistry).question:
Statement I : All liquids are conductors of electricity.
Statement II : Under the condition of low pressure and high voltage, liquids can be made conducting.
options: Both the statements are individually true and statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I.
Both the statements are individually true but Statement II is not the correct explanation of Statement I.
Statement I is true, but Statement II is false.
Statement I is false, but Statement II is true
Chemistry (Electrochemistry).answer: Statement I is false, but Statement II is true
Chemistry (Electrochemistry).explanation: All liquids are not conductors of electricity. Only the liquids which contain free ions or electrons, can conduct electricity.

Chemistry (Electrochemistry).subject: Chemistry (Electrochemistry)
Chemistry (Electrochemistry).question: Which one among the following will you put into pure water in order to pass electric current through it?
Chemistry (Electrochemistry).explanation: In lemon juice citric acid is present. Hence, acids are conductors of electricity. The aqueous solution of lime juice conducts electricity due to the presence of ions in it.

Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry)
Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).question:
Statement I : Oxides of sulphur and nitrogen present in high concentration in air are dissolved in rain drops.
Statement II : Oxyacids of sulphur and nitrogen make rain water acidic.
options: Both the statements are individually true and statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I.
Both the statements are individually true but Statement II is not the correct explanation of Statement I.
Statement I is true, but Statement II is false.
Statement I is false, but Statement II is true
Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).answer: Both the statements are individually true and statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I.
Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).explanation:
Oxides of sulphur and nitrogen present in high concentration in air dissolve in rain drops and form oxyacids of sulphur and nitrogen. These oxyacids are highly acidic in nature and therefore, they make rain water acidic.
4NO2 + 2H2O + O2 —> 4HNO3
2SO2 + 2H2O + O2 —> 2H2SO4
The pH of acid rain is 4 - 5

Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry)
Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).question: From which one among the following water sources, the water is likely to be contaminated with fluoride?
Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).explanation: Ground water is polluted by fluoride rich rocks which contain fluoride in large quantity.

Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry)
Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).question: Endosulfan, which has been in news these days, is
Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).explanation: Endosulfan is an organochlorine pesticide and acaricide which is used. Endosulfan became a highly controversial agrichemical due to large number of victims in kerala.

Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).subject: Chemistry (Chemical Reactions)
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).question:
Statement I : On mixing with water, plaster of Paris hardens.
Statement II : By combining with water, plaster of Paris is converted into gypsum. CaS04 -2Hp Gypsum
options: Both the statements are individually true and statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I.
Both the statements are individually true but Statement II is not the correct explanation of Statement I.
Statement I is true, but Statement II is false.
Statement I is false, but Statement II is true
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).answer: Both the statements are individually true and statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I.
Chemistry (Chemical Reactions).explanation:
On mixing with water, plaster of Paris hardens because it takes up the water of crystallisation again and thus, converts back into the dihydrate i.e., gypsum.
CaSO4.1/2H2O+1 1/2H2O ® CaSO4.2H2O
Plasterof Paris Gypsum

Chemistry (Materials & Alloys).subject: Chemistry (Materials & Alloys)
Chemistry (Materials & Alloys).question: Gypsum (CaSO4. 2H2O) is added to clinker during cement manufacturing to
options: decrease the rate of setting of cement
bind the particles of calcium silicate
facilitate the formation of colloidal gel
Chemistry (Materials & Alloys).answer: decrease the rate of setting of cement
Chemistry (Materials & Alloys).explanation: Gypsum (CaSO4 × 2H2O) is added to clinker during cement manufacturing to decrease the rate of setting of cement so, that it gets sufficiently hardens.

Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).question: What is the main constituent of a pearl?
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).explanation: Pearl consists of approximately 85% calcium carbonate.

Biology (Zoology).subject: Biology (Zoology)
Biology (Zoology).question: Polar bears are carnivores and prey on many arctic birds and fishes. However, under natural conditions, no one found polar bears predating any penguin. This is because
options: penguins have chemical substance in their muscles which is toxic to polar bears
penguins are gregarious and always move in groups. Therefore, a polar bear cannot approach them
polar bears and penguins never coexist under natural conditions. The former lives in the North Pole while the latter lives in the South Pole
polar bears and penguins display symbiotic relationships and they help each other for their existence in the ice-cold ecosystem
Biology (Zoology).answer: polar bears and penguins never coexist under natural conditions. The former lives in the North Pole while the latter lives in the South Pole
Biology (Zoology).explanation: Polar bears and penguins live in different polar regions i.e. polar bears live in the North Pole while the penguins live in Antarctica (the Southern Hemisphere).

Biology (Zoology).subject: Biology (Zoology)
Biology (Zoology).question: If we sprinkle common salt on an Earthworm, it dies due to
Biology (Zoology).explanation: The sprinkled salt dissolves in the water present on the moist skin of Earthworm and makes concentrated solution. The body fluid, being hypotonic, diffuses out and the worm dies due to osmotic shock (water loss- dehydration).

Biology (Human Diseases).subject: Biology (Human Diseases)
Biology (Human Diseases).question: To suspect HIV/AIDS in a young individual, which one among the following symptoms is mostly associated with?
options: Long standing jaundice and chronic liver disease
Biology (Human Diseases).explanation: After 4-8 weeks of infection by HIV virus to a healthy individual, the acute phase of HIV infection begins. About 30-60% people develop symptoms like severe persistant headache with sore throat and mild fever etc.

Biology (Human Diseases).subject: Biology (Human Diseases)
Biology (Human Diseases).question: Development of goitre (enlarged thyroid gland) is mainly due to deficiency of
Biology (Human Diseases).explanation: The cause of goitre is normally due to lack of iodine. Iodine plays an important role in the synthesis of thyroxine hormone from thyroid gland.

Biology (Botany).subject: Biology (Botany)
Biology (Botany).question: The anti-malarial drug quinine is made from a plant. The plant is
Biology (Botany).explanation: The cinchona plant has antimalarial alkaloids cinchonidine and quinine. Quinine is obtained from the bark of this plant.

Biology (Biochemistry).subject: Biology (Biochemistry)
Biology (Biochemistry).question: Cutting and peeling of onions brings tears to the eyes because of the presence of
Biology (Biochemistry).explanation: Cutting and peeling of onions bring tears to the eyes because of the presence of sulphur in the cell.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question: It has been observed that astronauts lose substantial quantity of calcium through urine during space flight. This is due to
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: Exposure to microgravity in the environment of space induces astronauts to lose calcium from bones. This loss takes place due to absence of ‘Earth gravity’ which disrupts the process of bone maintenance. The calcium is excreted out with urine.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question: Which one among the following will be absorbed fastest through the wall of digestive system?
options: Black coffee as a hot beverage
Raw alcohol taken as a drink
Biology (Human Physiology).answer: Raw alcohol taken as a drink
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: Raw alcohol after being drunk will be absorbed fastest through the wall of digestive tract. Alcohol is easily diffusible across the plasma membrance. It does not need any digestion before absorption in the alimentary canal. Therefore, its absorption begins from mouth, whereas the other substances are absorbed in the later parts of the alimentary canal.
